column1: hint of swing outside off, pushed through fuller, Tamim gets a long stride across to cover the line and bunts it into the off side
full and shaping away in the corridor of uncertainty at 84mph, Tamim shoulders arms
back of a length ball, on leg stump, tucked into the vacant spaces through square leg and they run two by the time the ball is fielded at the deep
fullish and around a set of stumps wide, left alone in the channel outside off
fuller and holding its line outside off, pushed off the front foot to mid-off
swing and a miss outside off. Sees width and opens up the shoulders, hint of late movement away outside off takes the ball away from him and he gets beaten
short of good length and angling away, stays in the crease, gets on top of it and drops it into the off side

sprayed on the pads, misses the batsman's attempted flick and the ball goes off the pads and goes down the leg side. Chandimal dives to his right but ends up pushing the ball away as he cannot get to it entirely and the ball goes down to fine leg
appeal for leg before. Fullish, pitching outside leg, misses the tuck of the batsman and the ball rolls away through the square leg region. Would have missed leg as well and review not taken
stays in the crease and blocks this delivery outside off towards mid-off
full and outside off, leans into a drive as it holds its line, the ball splits cover and mid-off and beats the two fielders giving it a chase all the way to the boundary
stays in the crease and opens the face of his bat to run it away to point
good length ball, hangs in the crease and presents a straight bat to defend it down the pitch
full and outside off at 138 clicks, pushes forward and drives to mid-off
full and wide outside off, comes forward and crunches a drive to short cover
carves it uppishly but luckily for him through the gap as the ball goes between cover and extra cover. Went through with the shot a tad early and ended up chipping it
oh, what a shot. Wristy stroke from Soumya. Width on offer and he does not come entirely forward, but it allows him the room he needs to carve it square of the wicket as the ball goes to deep point
good length ball, angled across on off. defended from the crease
defended into the off side from the crease
sort of good length and angling across at 133 clicks, defended from the crease
full and on the pads, clipped away off them through square leg. Comfortably beats point running back and deep backward square leg running across
full and angling across from leg and middle, stays in the crease and watchfully defends
good length ball, no movement , angled across outside off at 135 clicks and defended

oh, lovely shot. That is superb placement. Short of a length and not much room, he manufactures it by rocking back and brings the bat down late to run it down to third man. Fielder in the deep is too square and it runs away to the boundary
good length ball, stays in the crease and defends it into the off side
good length bal around off at 135kph, kept out from the crease
full and wide, uppishly driven square of the wicket. But he has again picked the gap well, right between point and backward point

edged, taken by the keeper. Plays across the line and perishes. It is angled in but fired from wide of the crease so it still comes on around the fifth-stump channel. Sarkar misreads the line and looks to flick it, closes the bat face early and gets a leading edge for his troubles
holding its line outside off, left alone
shaping away outside off this time and wide enough to be comfortably left alone
yorker, squeezed out to mid-on
short of good length ball, tucked off the pads to square leg
full and angling in on middle and leg, drills it to mid-on with the angle
short of good length, outside off, punched off the backfoot to covers
short of good length ball, swivels around and tries to fetch a pull from outside off, gets it right off the bottom of the bat into the off side
full, on leg, clipped away to midwicket
fired from wide of the crease and angled in, opens the face of his bat to run it down to square third man
fullish on off, works it to midwicket from the crease
full and angling in, drills it down the pitch
short of good length and angling in, swivels around and pulls it away to deep square leg. Picked up the length very early there
short of good length, just around off, tries to punch it through the off side and gets cramped for room. Inside-edged to the pads
this time there is room outside off and he opens the face of his bat to covers
short of good length ball, tight line, gives him no room and bowls it on the stumps, defended down the pitch
short of a length and on the pads, tucked away to deep square leg for one
short of a length outside off, dabs it off the inner part of the bat back to the bowler
too full, too wide outside off, inviting the batsman to free his arms and he carts it over extra cover as the ball goes on the bounce over the boundary
short, outside off, stands tall and lays into a pull shot as the ball goes a couple of bounces over the deep midwicket boundary
make that three in a row. Overcompensates with the length and again too full and too wide outside off, he crunches a drive through point
full and outside off, gets the front leg across and dabs it into the leg side
good length, angled in towards off and holding its line, defended solidly into the off side with bat close to pad
fuller and angling in on off, clipped away behind square where short fine leg makes a diving save
good length ball, shuffles across towards off and defends it off the inside part of the bat to the leg side
short ball, picks the length early but does not account for the line. Not enough room for the pull shot and he inside-edges it. The ball narrowly misses the stumps and runs down to fine leg
short of good length, punched off the backfoot to covers
slightly short of a length and wide outside off and what a shot that is from Tamim. Sees the width on offer and slaps it late, wide of backward point for four
good length ball, defended from the crease into the off side
full and angling in on the fourth-stump channel, driven back to the bowler
good length ball, takes a good stride forward and defends back to the bowler

angled in and this time it is not fired from as wide out of the crease. Plays the angle and pushes forward and the ball goes off the inside part of the bat to mid-on where the fielder makes a diving save

Bangladesh continue to find boundaries. This was a poor delivery and is asking to be put away. Short of good length and angling away, tucked off the hips and wide of the short fine leg fielder for four
fullish length ball and angling away outside off, defends with bat close to pad into the off side
and again, on a length and he comes across and bunts it into the off side off the front foot
back of a length, tucked off the pads to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, on the stumps, stands tall in the crease and keeps it out
good length outside off, stays in the crease and stabs it out to covers. No run there
short of good length ball, defended off the backfoot towards mid-off
pushed across on a fullish length from around the stumps, drilled into the leg side
full and pushed across on off, clipped out to square leg
loopy flighted ball outside off, eased down to long-off for one
fullish on leg, dabs it away to midwicket
flighted and sliding away on off, worked down to long-on
gets down to sweep but the ball has slid down the leg side and he misses the sweep. Called a wide
on a length and punched into covers off the backfoot
angled away and offers up a lot of width. Rocks back and plays it late as he guides it away to deep backward point where the fielder dives but the ball beats him
rapped on the pads and appeal for leg before. Misses the tuck of the batsman. Fullish and on leg, pitching outside leg as well

fuller, around a set of stumps outside off. Sabbir carts it over extra cover. Clears the in-field with ease and the ball goes on the bounce over the boundary. He took that one single and now he is back to dealing with boundaries
slower length ball, punches it down to long-off for an easy one. Fifty of the partnership
fullish and pushed across on off, kept out off the front foot
good length, outside off, pats it away to covers
sliding in with the arm on leg, fuller, and Sabbir gets down to sweep and gets it away to deep fine leg
drops it towards covers for a very quick single, a near-collision at the bowler's end but no damage in the end
sliding across on middle and off, comes forward and dabs it towards long-on for one
pitched up outside off, defended quietly off the front foot
floated up outside off, pushed down to long-off for a single
very full and on leg stump, gets down to sweep, gets it nowhere off the middle of the bat and the ball runs down to fine leg, off the bottom part of the blade
on a length and spinning away, shuffles across to cover the off stump and defends
sliding down leg and straightening, clips it away to midwicket and wants a run but is sent back by the non-striker
pitched up on off, driven crisply off the front foot back to the bowler
sliding down leg and it is full as well, so it allows Tamim to clip it away to deep backward square leg
pushed across on off at a fullish length, opens the face of his bat as he drives it out to sweeper cover
flat and wide outside off, backs away to cut but the ball is a bit too full, does not sit up and he chops it hard into the ground
on a length, knocks it back to the bowler
loopy flighted ball, drives it out to sweeper cover
sliding across on leg and middle, clipped away to deep midwicket
fired from wide of the crease, sliding in on off and turning away, slapped away to sweeper cover
fullish, clipped off the toes to mid-on
given too much air and bowls a full toss on leg, gets down to sweep early and just guides it on the paddle to deep fine leg
fullish on the stumps, too full to do anything after landing, clipped away to midwicket
full toss, pushed across on off, punched to covers

gets down to sweep again and gets rapped on the pads. Appeal for leg before and given by the umpire. They have reviewed it. And guess what. That has not hit the pad at all. It is pitched up and coming full on leg, he sweeps it and the ball has gone off the bottom of the bat to fine leg. Pad not involved anywhere. It was so full, so may have been hard to pick, but a very surprising decision by the umpire. Has been overturned
pitched up on middle and off, clipped away to mid-on off the front foot
pushes it a long way across and he shapes away to cut it. But the ball just goes on with the arm outside off, he is a long way away and misses
that's lucky. Comes charging down the track and looks for a mighty slog. Gets nowhere near it, head is not in a good position, so he is not in balance. Gets it away off the inside edge to fine leg
pushed across on off, clipped away to mid-on off the front foot
on a length on middle and leg, tucks it away to midwicket for one
advances down the ground and pushes it down to long-off for one after getting to the pitch
gets down to paddle but it is slipping down the leg side and called a wide
fullish on leg stump, pushed down to mid-on
tucked to midwicket. Man positioned there, so no run
shuffles across to protect off-stump and stabs this length ball into the off side
pitched up on off, comes forward and drives it to long-off
reverse sweep. Reads the length and the angle well very early. Fullish and he sends it through backward point for four
fullish and on the pads, clipped away to square leg
sliding down leg, misses the batsman's attempted late glance and the keeper as well as it runs away to the fine leg boundary
advances down the track to smother the spin and wears it on the pad. Long way down
flat and spinning away outside off, tries to cut it away but gets the timing all wrong, plays it very late, so the ball gets dragged down to long-off
goes for a reverse sweep but there is not the room to do it and he gets a glove to it and the ball goes to the keeper
fuller ball, eases it down to long-on for one
nicely flighted outside off, pushed down the ground to long-off for one and that is the fifty for Sabbir
tries to open the bat face and steer it away and picks out backward point
gets down to paddle early and just nudges it away to the square leg region. Does not pick him well and plays it late, so he can't find power on the sweep
pitched up outside off, comes forward and crunches it to point
this time he gets the desired power on the sweep because it is a poor delivery. Sprayed down the leg side and he makes good connection as the ball goes into the deep fine leg boundary
pitched up on leg and middle, swept again and this time it goes to backward square leg
pitched up outside off, drilled out to mid-off
gently bowls a fullish ball on leg and middle, pushed down the pitch for one
fullish length ball, no pace at all, comes forward and defends

what a catch. And it is the captain Upul Tharanga who snaffles a blinder. No pace on this fuller ball and Sabbir Rahman goes hard on the drive. The ball goes in the air and the Sri Lanka captain displays superb reflexes, dives to his left to take a stunning catch. Stays in balance throughout
looks like a full toss outside off but sips late and comes on at a fullish length, pushed down to long-on
comes forward and works it to point
on leg stump, nudges it away to backward square leg and Tamim wants the single. But there is a fielder inside the circle and he is sent back by the non-striker

appeal for caught-and-bowled. On-field umpire is unmoved, they go upstairs to check. Low, dipping full toss on middle and the bat hits the ground before the ball is chipped off the bottom of the bat as it goes back to the bowler. The ball has not bounced or hit any part of the ground at any point. Chipped to the right of the bowler who moves fluidly and bends forward to take the catch. Big, big blow, in-form Mushfiqur has been sent back for one
pitched up outside off, carves it hard through point who gives it a chase and they come back for two by the time he can pick it up
fullish outside off, driven past the bowler who dives to his right and it goes down to long-off
shuffles across and bunts this length ball into the off side
pitched up outside off, comes forward and drills it back to the bowler
full toss, whipped away to deep midwicket for one
on leg stump, tucked off the pads to square leg
short and wide, no pace, slapped square of the wicket and sweeper cover runs across to cut it off
moving away sharply outside off That was the cutter. Spins a mile like an off-break, grips and turns and beats the outside edge
and again, this one is spinning too, but not as sharply and it is pushed out into the off side off the front foot
gives it some air and bowls it full on the pads, pushed down to long-on for one
full, on leg, gets the front foot out of the way and defends
fuller ball, pushed off the front foot back to the bowler
turning away and giving him some width outside off, opens the face of his bat late to guide it past the diving first slip to third man boundary
on a length and spinning away, comes forward and defends to covers with bat close to pad
comes a long way forward and pushes this fuller ball to covers
full on leg, clipped away into the leg side
defended off the front foot back to the bowler
short and wide outside off, cut away to deep point
too short, he hops across and whips it to deep midwicket. 35th half-century for Bangladesh's mastaan.
eased past the bowler to mid-off as he jogs the single
slow turn from middle, gets a long way forward and dabs it to the off side
too full on the pads, works it behind square, straight to the fielder
punches a length ball on off to long-off
drifting into middle and leg, whipped into the vacant spaces at deep midwicket
tossed up on middle and leg, eased down the ground to long-on
too full on off stump, squeezed to long-off. Sensible stuff
lunges forward and smothers the spin
firm push past the bowler to long-off
gets forward and defends back to the bowler
gets to the pitch of the ball and eases it with the spin to long-off
width and he's driven that through the line to sweeper cover
grips and spins away a touch from middle, punched to long-off as they jog the single
chops a short ball past point. Looked to hit it really hard but played a little too early this time
shows the full face of the bat as he eases a full-length delivery to long-off
tossed up gently on off stump, eased through the line again to long-off
pushed through quicker on off, punched to cover
slides back in from around the stumps, this one keeps a touch low but he's deep into the crease and right behind the line in defending it wide of cover
misfield by the bowler on his followthrough gives away an easy single
width on offer, crashed away but straight to deep cover
fired full and wide outside off, he backed away to steer it behind square but missed
driven straight to cover. Uppish and on the bounce to Tharanga
short and spinning away from outside off, forced to deep cover
gets forward to work it to the leg side but the ball grips the surface and hits him on the pad
goes back deep into the crease to punch that short of length delivery to long-on
too full on off stump, eased to long-off
sweeps and misses. This was too full and tossed up down leg, there for the paddle but he played too early
grips and turns. Tamim, pushing forward, was squared up. Didn't miss the edge by much. Puff of dust as well from the surface as that ripped across a long way. Now that will excite Mehedi Hasan
gets forward and punches the short ball to long-off
skids back in to hit him on the pad off a thick inside edge
delightful stroke. Gets to the pitch of the ball, makes room and then lofts him inside-out over cover. Played it with the spin so it was risk-free
fired full outside off, squeezed to deep cover
punched to deep cover. On the shorter side this time
a misfield at long-off by Kumara gives away three extra runs. Driven firmly but he had to simply get his body behind the ball to keep it down to a single. Made a right royal mess of that

thumped into the gap between deep cover and long-off. Too much flight this time, Tamim negated whatever little turn there may have been by getting to the pitch and then letting his bat and placement do the rest. Super batting this
too much width again, cracked off the backfoot behind point. The boundary rider does well to run across from deep cover to cut that off
opens the face of the bat and steers to cover

big appeal from Chandimal, but umpire Michael Gough is sure there was no edge. Shakib lured into the drive even though he didn't get to the pitch and was beaten. Tharanga doesn't think there was an edge either. Too much time taken in the end, can't review. Right decision made
fired into middle and leg, tucked to square leg
slow turn from middle, punched wide of point
gets forward and then covers for the late deviation as he defends
fires one down leg, Chandimal does well to stop that
too short, he rocks back and pulls to deep square leg
tossed up but drifting down leg. Good take by Chandimal, but enough for the umpire to signal wide. He's getting the ball to drift in a long way
stretches forward and blocks
whips a length ball on middle to midwicket, where Tharanga throws himself to the left and cuts off the single
gets down on one knee and paddles the short delivery to fine leg
rocks back and pulls into the gap at midwicket. Dragged this too short, Tamim picked the length early and played it all along the ground
goes back into the crease and cracks that short delivery into the wide open spaces at deep point. The outfield that side is on the slower side
tucks a length ball off his hip to square leg
deflects an away-going length ball to third man
not much room to ease that length ball behind point, chopped to the fielder instead
slower delivery, looking to bowl a cutter, but it's on middle and leg. Shakib gets some thigh pad on it as he tries to work it to the leg side
pulled but straight to short midwicket
gets on top of the bounce and pulls him all along the ground. The placement is superb too. Deep square had no more than 10 yards to move to his right, but couldn't do so despite the dive. Top shot
gets forward and eases it down the ground for an easy single
flatter and a touch closer to the stumps from wide of the crease, bunted to the off side
punches one against the turn to Tharanga at midwicket
appeal for lbw but the ball pitched miles outside leg. Deflects off the pad to fine leg as he tries to nurdle it fine
excellent stop at point. This was hit really hard
right behind the line in defence
length ball that snakes back into middle and leg, tucked to square leg as they pinch a quick single
too full on off stump, defended from the crease to cover
nurdled behind square, the man in the deep was caught napping. Shakib called for two and completed it easily
full and straight on middle, the ball tails away a wee bit but Shakib is behind the line as he squeezes that back down the pitch
drifting into the pads, tickled away past short fine. Didn't get as much bat as he would've liked. Slowness of the delivery meant he needed much more to get a boundary
stands tall and steers the length ball to point
worked off the pad to deep square
fired through on middle, Shakib tries to use the pace and steer it behind square but hits it straight to short third man
swept and hit really well. Freebie down leg, Shakib is down on one knee as he powers it behind square
short and wide outside off, steered into the gap at deep point. The fielder took ages to get to the ball, by which time Shakib had hared back for the second
forced off the backfoot to deep cover
defended back to the bowler
short and wide outside off, eased to point
bunts a length ball on middle to point again
works a length ball off the stumps towards deep square leg
tucked off the hip to the leg side
looks to whip this Jayasuriya style over deep backward square but played too early and is hit high on the thigh pad. Ball deflects towards short fine
driven to long-on. Thisara looks to stop it with his boot on the followthrough but can't
lunges forward and defends
grip and slow turn from middle, bunted to cover
gets forward and deadbats the tossed up delivery
driven down to long-off as he jogs the single
too short, slapped to deep cover
stretches forward and defends one off the inside edge to the bowler
pulled to deep square leg. Flat hit to the man there
punches the length ball to point
punches a length ball to deep midwicket. The ball just kept going away from the boundary rider, who had to dish in a slide to cut that off
forced off the frontfoot to deep point
leading edge back down the pitch as they squeeze a quick single
slower length ball on leg, worked to the man at deep midwicket
punched to long-off as they jog a single
too full on middle and leg, turned to long-on
flat-bats a pull but Asela does well to stop it on his followthrough
gets to the pitch of the ball and eases it inside-out to long-off
too short, he backs away to make room and then crunch one to deep extra cover.
pulled to deep backward square leg. The fielder switched off for a split-second, enough to get back for the second.
lunges forward and blocks
pulled into the gap at deep midwicket. That should release some of the pressure that was building on him. Half-tracker, too easy
driven with the spin to deep cover
too much flight but he can't take toll of that. Hit straight to cover
eased to deep point, called for two and Tamim blindly trusted his partner's call, made it easily
whipped into the gap at deep midwicket and wide long-on. Call was for two but they won't get it as the fielder swooped in quickly
worked behind square on the leg side to the man in the deep

leaps in the air, signature Tamim celebration. Nudged off the hip towards deep square. Takes time to reflect on the moment, then takes off his helmet and soaks in the applause of his team-mates. 8th ODI ton for him
arches back and helps the short delivery wide of the keeper, third man cuts it off. He got it high on the bat

steps out and blasts the length ball to mid-off as he scampers across for a quick single. There was a direct hit but Tamim had already grounded his bat. The early movement he took allowed him to run through with the momentum

pitch map confirms the ball clearly pitched outside the line. So even if it may have gone on to hit the stumps, it can't be out. Some drama in this over. Ridiculous review, I think they took it just because they had one

another shout for lbw, turned down again. The ball deflects to third man. He was trying to work it behind square on the leg side but was deceived by the slower one. Pitched outside leg again. They take the run off the deflection to third man
punches a length ball to cover. The ball skid through faster than he expected
length ball on the pads, worked to short fine leg to bring up his 33rd ODI fifty. This is his fourth against Sri Lanka

flayed over cover. Delightfully done. Backed away and lofted him through the line. Hit it with the breeze too. Intelligent shot-selection. That was bowled at 103kph only, so he had to generate the timing which he did superbly
looked to swing this to Galle, but missed. Too full and tailing away, played too early
attempts to muscle the full toss over deep midwicket, on the bounce to the fielder. Cramps? Is he tiring? The bottom hand loosened as ball made contact
gets across the stumps and paddles the length ball towards fine leg
full toss on the pads, worked to deep square leg. Timed well but didn't pick the gap
looks to go over long-on, gets the inner half of the bat instead as it rolls to the fielder there

helped into the fine leg boundary. Desperate dive by Pathirana but he got a bad bounce. Should have still tried to get the body behind that. Poor delivery too, way too short and down leg. Picked away easily

drilled over the infield, this was no more than a couple of metres away from long-on but such was the power in the stroke that even he stood no chance. Played with a straight bat. All muscle. Superb from Shakib

lofted over mid-off this time. The fielder was inside the ring. What awareness. The umpires checking with the third umpire to see if it hit the ropes on the full. Once again showing the full face of the bat as it came down in a lovely little arc. One bounce into the boundary, comes the message from upstairs.
full toss outside off, flayed to deep cover.
floats this full and wide outside off, Shakib looks to carve this over point but misses. Saw the batsman making room and fired it wide. Good thinking from Lakmal

plays a half-sweep drill back down the pitch. Lakmal, on his followthrough, is hit on the body. Rocket hit from Shakib. He was looking to sweep but ended up smashing it back down the ground. Umpire Gough, behind him, was also trying to take evasive action. For now, Lakmal is in a lot of pain. Looks like he's been hit on the thumb. Concern. Physio rushes out
flat-bats a pull to deep midwicket
this is massive. Walks across the stumps after seeing the bowler float it wide and takes it from around the seventh stump and muscles this over long-on. Superb

he's picked out short fine leg. Looked to help it over the fielder there but this was a slower deliver and he couldn't force enough pace to get it over. Shakib was starting to run away with this. Looks like he got it off the glove. Sandakan, the nervy Sandakan, manages to hang on.
too full and sliding into middle and leg, he works it into the gap behind square. No one there. Deep midwicket can't get around to cut that off.
backs away and lofts the low full toss inside-out over cover. Splits the gap between deep cover and long-off
hit back really hard, Thisara gets a hand on his followthrough, deflects to long-off.
lofted but plonks in no man's land: between mid-off and mid-on
flat-bats a pull to long-on
too full on middle from around the stumps, whips the ball into the deep midwicket region
right into the blockhole at the base of leg stump, squeezed to the off side
length ball outside leg and he's flicked it nonchalantly into the gap at deep square. Used the pace to good effect. Too easy for a man in the form of his life
pulled into the deep midwicket region, this time there's a man for protection there
backs away and bunts the length ball to cover for a quick single
dropped! Sri Lanka's fielding woes from the Tests have spilled over. This was slapped to deep square where Milinda Siriwardena parries the ball over the boundary. Didn't look like catching it at all.

another short ball, looks to muscle this over long-on but finds Gunathilaka there. This had a lot of power but he got down low, cupped both hands and allowed them to lodge safely. End of a super knock from Tamim. A tad slow initially, picked up the pace, again slowed down after the century and then again accelerated in quest for quick runs.
ducks under the short ball on middle, way over the batsman's head
eases the length ball to deep point
hit on the pad but he was bowling from around the stumps and the ball pitched miles outside leg. Deflects to midwicket
punched over the bowler's head. Long-on does all the hard work in running around and then dives over the ball. Dambulla Bridge can we call it? Oh, dear.
squeezes a full delivery to deep cover, Asela hares across to get to the ball quickly and then fires a rocket throw

heaved over deep midwicket. The man there had a chance just for a split-second but he was on the move and airborne as he tried to catch. The ball just burst through again. Can't bowl length from around the wicket. Excellent effort from Seekkuge Prasanna.
driven firmly to extra cover
makes room and then uses the pace of the bowler to split the gap between point and short third man. Who said batting in the end overs is all about brute force? Intelligent stuff this
whipped into the deep midwicket region, excellent running to get back for the second. Fielder in the deep late to get off the blocks
short ball sliding down leg, he shuffles across to nurdle it fine but couldn't do much about it. Angle taking it down
looks to help the short ball over short fine, once again strays down leg. I'd be disappointed if I was the batsman. Should have been helped over the fielder at the edge of the ring on the leg side
slower and fuller outside off, punched to cover

moves to the leg side, bowler follows him and then Mosaddek wrists this into the gap at deep fine leg. The throw is on the bounce to Chandimal, who looks to deflect it to the stumps but can't. One for the overthrow. What match awareness

flat-bats the pull and it has sailed over the ropes at deep square leg. Moved to the leg side and then played the tennis shot. Ah, the fearlessness of youth. Looked to tuck him up but followed him, no problems for Mosaddek. Sensational batting
drills the full delivery to cover
full toss outside off, gets a thick inside edge to deep square leg, back for the second easily. This is the fourth highest total against SL in SL. Outstanding batting effort
short of good length ball, angling away outside off, punched off the backfoot to covers
full and on the pads, uses his wrists to clip it nicely off the pads, does so uppishly but the ball drops short of the fielder at midwicket

looks plumb and given. This is a serious blow for Sri Lanka, early wicket is the last thing they needed. Gunathilaka consults with his captain and asks for a review. Short of good length, angling across on middle and straightening. Beats the inside edge of the batsman and hits the front pad. No bat involved, replays confirm. Clipping the top of middle and off, just about brushing the bails, and the umpire's call remains. Sri Lanka have lost an early wicket as well as their one review
hint of shape away outside off. Mendis does not bother jabbing at it and lets it go
fullish length outside off, shaping away, left alone
angling in on a length and straightening, stays in the crease and keeps it out on the off side. Great start by Mashrafe
sharp turn straight away. On a length and giving him room as it turns outside off, Tharanga pats it away towards point
goes over the in-field and clears it comfortably. This one is pitched up and Tharanga is able to get on top of it well. Sri Lanka need to take these chances, and carts it over the covers region
fullish again and it is worked down to long-off
good length ball, spinning in on middle and leg, defended into the leg side
on a length and not much turn, and that is sloppy from the midwicket fielder. Lets the ball go as it is tucked towards him and allows the batsmen to take one run
good length ball, plays for the turn but it does not spin much, comes on with the angle and finds the inside part of Tharanga's bat as he defends

short of good length and cutting back in to beat the flick and hit the batsman's pad. Appeal for leg before and not given by the umpire. Seems to be heading down leg. Mashrafe goes for the review. Angle was sharp and it would have missed leg. Bangladesh lose their review as well
short of good length ball, angling in, uses the angle to nudge it to the leg side
short of a length ball, nudged into the leg side
back of a length and holding its line outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, holding its line outside off, defended from the crease towards covers
edged and falls short of the keeper. Good length ball, sticks his bat out and gets an outside edge that goes on the bounce to the keeper
sharp turn. Draws him forward with a length ball and beats the outside edge by a distance
plays for the turn this time and the ball comes on with the angle, takes the inside edge and goes towards the fine leg region

tries to loft this over the leg side and not in control. Tries to take on the mid-on fielder and the spin means he cannot find the middle of the bat and the ball lands safely around the midwicket region

appeal for stumping. Referred upstairs. And I'll tell you what. That is very, very tight. Seems like a goner. Comes forward to a length ball and looks to open the face of his bat. The ball spins sharply and the foot has just come out of the line. Question is if he has entirely slid it back in. Does not seem like from the first angle. The bails are off and he has brought the foot back in but it seems to be on the line. Rahim was quite confident. This is taking some time as the TV umpire makes use of various angles to ascertain if any part of the foot is inside the line. On the line is what it seems to be. I reckon this will go in favour of the bowler. He may have got a spike or two inside the line. But even those seem to be on the line. Oh, the TV umpire has ruled not out. But that was really, really close.
plays for the turn and finds the inside part of the bat as the ball goes back to the bowler
turning away, comes forward and pushes into the off side, to the point region
short of good length, stands tall and punches it into the off side
back of a length and shaping away outside off. Tries to cut but the late movement means he can only chop it off the toe end of the bat
short of a length, angling across, tries to cut but there is not enough room and he does not make contact
width on offer outside off, opens up the shoulders and crashes it through point. First boundary off Mashrafe
back of a length and some width on offer again, stays in the crease and stabs it to point
short of good length ball, rides the bounce and pats it to point
back of a length, does not turn as much as he expected and gets rapped on the pad. Hit high
comes down the track and wears it on the pad as the ball goes to short fine leg and they take him on for a quick single. slower through the air and some turn as well
backs away to make room and cuts this out to point where Shuvagata Hom makes a diving save. DIves full-length to his right and releases it quickly to Rahim
fullish length, comes forward and pushes, the ball goes off the outside part of the bat to the off side
on a length, tucked off the pads behind square on the leg side

holes out to long-on. Lack of runs and mounting run rate, and the pressure gets to the batsman. And full marks to the bowler as well, unafraid to toss it up. Mendis decides to take him on, comes down the track and lofts it. Not enough behind it and it goes straight down the throat of long-on
back of a length and angling in, tucked off the pads to deep backward square leg
length, holding its line, left alone in the channel outside off
short ball, hint of movement away off the seam, misses the attempted cut of the batsman
good length, left alone outside off
length on off, stays in the crease and defends towards mid-off
good length ball, defended back to the bowler from the crease
fullish length, defended off the front foot to the off side
fullish, pushed off the front foot to mid-off
good length, spinning in sharply, tries to tuck off the pads, misses and wears it on them instead as the ball goes to square leg. Yes-and-no on the single but they make it safely in the end
fuller ball, clipped to deep midwicket for one
flat and full, on the pads, clipped away behind square on the leg side. They take on the fielder and comecharging back for the second
turning in sharply, off the pads to square leg
short of good length ball, outside off, punched off the backfoot to mid-off who is slightly back
short of good length, outside off, punched from the crease down the pitch. No run there
fuller on off, comes forward and pushes it wide of mid-off for one
good length ball, outside off, punched off the backfoot to covers, cannot pierce the field there
good length, angling in on off and middle, stays in the crease and opens the face of his bat as the ball goes to cover-point
short of good length, width on offer this time and he has creamed that between cover and point for four. Spoils an otherwise good over for Bangladesh
plays for the turn and closes the face of his bat, the ball straightens instead and finds the outside edge as it goes to the third man region
tossed up on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
fullish, dabbed away to mid-on for one
full and angling in, drilled back to the bowler
sliding in with the arm, flighted on leg, pushed back to the bowler
backs away but the bowler follows him, he makes an attempt at a cut but cannot find the gap on the off side
short of good length ball, jumps up to ride the bounce and he gets an inside edges and wears it on the body
back of a length, angling in, tucked away to square leg
full and angling in, misses out as he cannot flick it away and wears it on the pad
short of good length, stands tall and punches off the backfoot to sweeper cover
short ball, gets cramped for room as he looks to pull it away and wears it on the ribs instead

chipped tamely to mid-on. That is a desperate shot and there is stunned silence at the ground. Short ball, looking to pull and there is no room absolutely. Does not find the middle of the bat and gets big on him as well. Ahat is the simplest of catches to the Bangladesh captain, off the splice of the bat
pitched up, crunched to covers
flighted outside off and gives him a lot of room as well, crunches a drive to extra cover
loopy flighted ball, on leg, driven out to long-off
loopy, sliding in on a length, kept out off the front foot
pitched up outside off, caresses it off the front foot to long-off
short of a length, outside off, shuffles across to cover the off-stump and lets it go
fullish length, angling in, defended back to the bowler
width on offer outside off, opens the face of the bat and steers it to point
back of a length, angling in, tucked with the inward angle to deep fine leg for one
short and wide outside off, cut away to sweeper cover for one
hangs back and opens the face of his bat to run it down fine to the third man region for four
loopy fullish ball, outside off, comes forward and drives it out to the left of sweeper cover
plays for turn and the ball simply comes on with the arm, takes the inside part of the bat and goes to mid-on
pitched up, driven off the front foot to the left of Shakib, extra cover makes a diving save
and another diving save by the extra cover fielder as the ball is driven out to him
fullish, pushed back to the bowler
full again and sliding in with the arm this time, drilled down to long-on for one
good length, cutting back in, defended to the right of Taskin
short ball, gets slightly big on him but he manages to keep it out
good length outside off, defended back to the bowler
gets the front foot across to meet the pitch of this one and defends into the off side
back of a length, drops it in front of covers for one
full and wide outside off, presses forward and crunches a drive out to covers
pitched up and drawing the batsman into the drive, he obliges but cannot beat extra cover
that missed the stumps by millimetres. Chandimal gets down for a big slog sweep, gets an inside edge and the ball runs down to deep fine leg
advances down the ground and tucks it away to fine leg. Short fine dives to his right but parries it away with the momentum and they could have come back for three had they run harder
gets it away to midwicket off the inside part of the bat
short ball, does not get up as much, Gunaratne lofts it through square leg and the ball lands on the bounce in front of the fielder in the deep
fullish outside off, drives it off the front foot and cover makes a diving stop
stays in the crease to this length ball and gets an inside edge to short fine leg
low full toss outside off, driven out to sweeper cover for one
back of a length, deliberately opens the bat face late and plays it off the splice to third man. The fielder is squarer and runs across and slides but the ball goes to the boundary
good length on off, comes forward and blocks into the off side
short ball, gets big on him, tries to pull and gets a top edge that goes well over the keeper's head and into the boundary
full and angling in on the pads, the ball goes off the pad to square leg and the keeper has to run across as there is no one there. They think of the second but decide against it
loopy and fullish, on off, pushed back to the bowler
on a length and sliding in on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on for one
angling in on leg and straightening, clipped into the leg side
backs away to manufacture room and forces cuts to sweeper cover
flighted outside off, carves it out to sweeper cover for one
beautifully bowled. Flights it up and draws the batsman forward, Chandimal sticks the bat out and the ball turns sharply to beat the outside edge
on the money straight away, fullish length and bang on middle, defended
is that the cutter? On a length and shaping away. He rolled his fingers across it and that turned away from the right-hander, beats the outside edge as Gunaratne opens the bat face
slower and pushed across, looking to drive but gets beaten by the lack of pace
good length ball, defended from the crease
back of a length and shaping away, hangs back in the crease and opens the face of his bat to guide it down to third man
looking to steer it away to third man but there is not enough room and the short of a length ball bounces more than he would have liked and gets big on him
flighted and sliding in, pushed down to long-on for one
appeal for leg before. Not given. Gets down to reverse sweep and misses. Was the impact outside off? Seems pretty close for sure
fullish, driven down to long-off for one
pitched up on leg, pushed down to long-on for one
flat, back of a length, arm ball, skids through quickly and misses the flick of the batsman
loopy flighted ball, sliding on leg, clipped to midwicket for a tight single
plays for turn and the ball comes on with the angle, takes the inside part of the bat and goes back to the bowler
short of a length, tries to cut but no room on offer and chops it
chases a wide delivery without feet and force a drive. Gets an inside edge that misses the stumps and goes away to deep fine leg
on a length, on leg stump, 133 clicks, plays it on to the pads and the ball goes into the off side
full and angling away, presses forward to meet the pitch and pushes it out to sweeper cover for one
shot! Shot of the innings so far. Comes down the track to this length ball and slashes this between extra cover and mid-off. That was bowled with a cross-seam again
pokes at a wide delivery outside off. Full and way, way out of his reach, gets beaten for his troubles
sliding in on leg, pushed to the left of the bowler
pitched up on leg, gets the front leg out of the way and sweeps along the carpet to deep backward square leg
appeal for leg before Umpire not interested at all. Think he got a bat on that one
flighted and full outside off, driven out to long-off who is very wide
on a length, sliding in with the arm, punched to covers
chips it in the air and the ball lands in front of mid-on
full, on middle, pushed back to the bowler
full toss outside off, just opens the face of his bat and carves it to third man
fullish on off, comes forward and pushes it to covers. Drills it hard into the ground and the ball goes on the up
on a length, drops it in front of covers and there is a bit of hesitation as they take off for the single. Direct throw at the striker's end and Gunaratne would have been out by a mile
very full, outside off, driven along the carpet to square third man
reverse sweep, picks out backward point. Full and outside off, he fails to keep it along the ground and it could not have gone straighter to the man there as he dives forward and completes the take
fullish outside off, drilled down to long-on for one
plays late at this length ball and gets it off the inside edge to the fine leg region. Nearly went through the defences there
on the pads, tucked away to square leg
pitched up outside off, comes forward and opens the face of his bat as the ball is guided to short third man
fired from wide of the crease and sliding in on off, drops it to the covers region for one
tries to flick and gets rapped on the pads. Appeal for leg before turned down. Pitching outside leg. That was the cutter
full and wide outside off, has to reach out a long way and cannot put bat to ball
good length, pitching outside leg, defended off the front foot into the off side

full toss, flicked away through midwicket and what an effort from the fielder. Mosaddek the man. Gives it a chase all the way and slides just in front of the deep midwicket boundary to save one for his team
fuller, outside off, plays the angle and gets an inside edge to the on side
slashes at this wide delivery and the ball runs down to third man. Taskin is squarer and runs across, slides to his right to cut it off in front of the ropes
length ball, comes forward and defends
poor delivery, full and on the pads, gets down to sweep and works it away to deep fine leg
flat and full outside off, comes forward and pushes it into the off side
short of a length, whipped from the crease with a half-angled bat to wide long-on
flat and on a length, punched from the crease to long-on
good length, on leg, tucked off the pads to backward square leg
too full and too wide, Chandimal comes forward and crashes this through covers for four. The ball races away into the extra cover boundary and that brings up the fifty for Chandimal
on a length and raps him on the pads as he fails to flick it away, appeal for leg before, would have missed leg. Mustafizur runs across and fires a throw at his end but the steal a single
too full, pushed back to the bowler
beautifully done. On a length, comes forward and spins sharply to beat the outside edge
flicked away to midwicket
backs away to cut and chops it into the ground. Lucky to have not chopped on to the stumps. He was cramped for room
flat and on the pads, turned away to deep midwicket who fails to gather it cleanly and the fumble allows them to come back for the second
spinning in from a fullish length, clipped away to deep square leg this time
backs away and cuts uppishly, but he has done well to split the gap, gets it between point and extra cover. Sweeper cuts it off
flat, short of good length, pulls and the ball goes from under the diving mid-on fielder
pitched up on off, clipped away to mid-on
eased down to long-off for one
reverse sweep, played uppishly through backward point where it is vacant and the ball beats sweeper cover running to his left
flighted on off, eased down to long-on for one
pitched on leg stump, turns it away to backward square leg

gone, caught at short fine leg. Attempting a sweep shot and the ball is not full enough. Does not account for the bounce as a result and gets a top edge that lobs to short fine leg. Soumya Sarkar runs a few steps to his right and snaffles it
fuller and outside off, driven to mid-off
driven with the spin to the bowler
lofted over the infield to deep extra cover
full and flat on middle from around the stumps, he gets down on one knee and brings the broom out to sweep it to deep square leg
swung away into the deep midwicket boundary. Sitting up nicely for him to bring out the slog across the line, hit it off the middle.
sharp turn from off stump, punched to point
drifts back in, grips the surface and then rips away to square him up. Top delivery
gets forward and defends
slog sweep lands in no man's land. This one bounced a little more, midwicket running back didn't have a chance this time even though it wasn't timed well
lunges forward and smothers the spin
slider on middle from wide of the crease, bunted back to the bowler
top shot. Too much flight, he backs away to make room and then smokes it inside-out. One bounce into the wide long-off boundary
looked to swing over the leg side, only managed a thick inside edge to short square leg
appeal for caught behind but there was daylight between bat and ball. He tried to use the pace of the bowler and steer it past short third man but missed
Mushfiqur started yelling 'bowler, bowler' even before the shot was hit. Forced off the backfoot to deep cover
play and a miss. Turn and bounce
punched from the crease to deep cover. The man coming in didn't have much ground to cover but Mushfiqur had to let him know again which end to throw even though there was no threat of a run-out
swept into the fine leg boundary. Gets outside the line of the stumps and uses the pace of the bowler to pick the gap
rocks back and cuts the short ball to deep cover
skiddy short ball angling away, looks to pull but gets it high on the bat, rolls to the off side
risky shot. Trying to glide an away-going length ball to third man but beaten by the late away movement
gets on top of the bounce and steers the short delivery to backward point
whips a back of length delivery off the hip to deep square leg
glides an away-going delivery to square third man
floats this full outside off, bunted to point as they scamper a quick single
beaten by a beauty that angles back in from wide of the crease and leaves him late. He tried to angle it down to third man
solid hit. Too full, right in his arc and he hammers this over the bowler's head. Risk-free shot. Picked the slower one and timed it beautifully

top catch by Shuvagata Hom. Had a lot of work to do, ran nearly 20 yards to his right and then dished in a slide to pull off a low catch. Took it where deep midwicket would've been stationed. This was short, and while the intent was right, he didn't quite get hold of the pull shot.
deviates off the seam from length on off stump, defended to cover
too full and wide outside off, squeezed to backward point
bowls this cross-seam. The ball grips the surface and deviates back in to cramp him for room, bunted to point
gloves a short ball to square leg. Hustled for pace
punches one on the up to mid-off
another short ball that gets big on him, pulled but it plonk near midwicket as it hit the top part of the bat
width and he's slapped that on the up to deep cover
is pushed back into the crease by the pace, defended but is off balance when ball hits bat. Taskin is hitting the high 140s
gets half-forward and defends the length ball on middle to the off side
gets behind the line of that short ball and turns it to short midwicket
diving stop at short fine leg. The skipper throws himself to his right to stop that flick. Had four written all over it
worked behind square again to Mashrafe, they scamper a quick single
runs down the pitch to swing one over cover, but played too early and missed it
width and he's slapped that away into the deep extra cover boundary. Sabbir hares across and then puts in the dive but couldn't get there
slower and fuller outside off, looks to go over cover but the ball grips and comes back in to take a thick inside edge to deep midwicket
hit on the top part of the bat as he looked to pull in front of square, manages to get this to mid-on somehow
looks to pull but then realises he's cramped for room, and so he chops it with an angled bat. Nearly played on
right into the yorker-zone outside off, looks to back away and squeeze it behind square but is late to jam his bat down
just manages to elude Mahmudllah at mid-on. Steep bounce again, he tried to play a flat-batted pull and got it high on the bat
right into the blockhole on leg stump, squeezed to midwicket
banged in short on middle and leg, he ducks under it

as easy as they come as far as catches go. Had to go for it. Mashrafe floats an off-cutter full and wide outside off, Pathirana sees this as an opportunity to biff this over deep midwicket but didn't  have any pace to work with. Ended up skewing it straight to Mahmudullah who reverse cups one at cover. Too easy. Had too much time at one stage, and that can make fielders nervous at the best of times. Not this time though.
skies it but this is a top-edge that flies over short fine leg. Steep bounce again
whips an incoming length ball on middle and leg to midwicket
appeal for lbw as the ball cuts back in sharply from outside off. May have been saved by an inside edge. Certainly would have missed the stumps anyway
works a length ball on leg to deep backward square
short outside off, punched to deep cover
swing and a miss. Looked to flat-bat the pull but this wasn't all that short
off-cutter on leg stump, worked across the line to the man coming in from fine leg
full and sliding down leg, there was an opportunity for him to use the pace and flick it fine but he missed
slaps the length ball to deep point. Far from being in his half but he simply flayed that with minimal movement
the effort ball but way down leg, rightly called wide
slower one on middle, punched to mid-off
sitting up nicely for him to pull and Lakmal does just that. Cleanly in front of square. Had enough time in the world. Tired delivery
fetches the pull from outside off, straight to midwicket
flicked into the vacant spaces at deep midwicket, one bounce into the boundary. It got more elevation than distance. That gave the man at deep square a sniff but in the end, a task too steep

goes again. A repeat of the previous delivery. Same shot. A hoick over deep midwicket. The only difference was this time the bottom hand came off the bat handle but he still generated power and strength for it to nearly carry all the way.
muscled over long-on. Ladies and gentlemen, Thisara is in the mood. Pitched up, he got underneath the delivery and swung it cleanly across the line. Is the game still alive?
thick inside edge on the flick to square leg
works a length delivery from the fifth stump to midwicket
punches a length ball on middle and leg to mid-on
floats a full toss way outside off, Lakmal can't reach out too it
off the thick edge to third man
angles a full delivery into the pads, flicked to deep backward square leg. Excellent work from Mosaddek
thumped to long-off. Looked to go over the top but it ended up being a flat hit

simple catch at mid-on. Why would you want to be a hero when you can simply nudge the ball and enjoy the big hits from the other end? This is Mustafizur's stock delivery: a cutter that deviates a long way from length on middle, Lakmal swings leg side and toe-ends the slog to Sabbir who takes a dolly.
high full toss, hit flat to long-on
slower and fuller outside off, left alone
eased towards cover. The man from the deep had to come in a long way from the ropes, by which time they completed the second. The throw wasn't the best either
slapped to the man at the edge of the ring at cover
appeal for lbw but the ball may have missed the stumps. Mehedi was so sure, but the ball spun back in sharply
worked with the spin to long-on
swing and a miss. Looked for an almighty heave over deep midwicket
fired full on the pads, worked to long-on

flat-bats a biggie over long-on. Picked the length early and muscled it. Brute force. The ball boys there were ducking for cover. Couldn't have so easily smashed into the face of one of the kids there. He coped one on his backside instead
floated full outside off, squeezed to deep cover
squeezed to third man off a thick edge
full toss on the pads and he brings out those powerful wrists to bisect the gap between deep midwicket and long-on

eased into the gap between cover and point. The man from the deep took ages to get off the blocks, Shakib running backwards was also ambling towards the ball. Thisara saw the opportunity and scampered back for the second. First half-century in two and a half years for him
sweet timing to flay that to deep cover. Excellent running to come back for the second
lunges forward and turns it with the spin to the leg side
punched down to long-on, sensible stuff. Give the strike back to the big man
slow turn, punches one to cover. Was winding up and looking to slog over midwicket
top-edges a reverse sweep, safe. Just wide of short third man

turns this with the spin but Mustafizur is quick to swoop in on the ball and fire a throw. Sandakan took a couple of steps outside his crease and waited for some reason. Then took off again. Was a couple of yards short when the bails were broken.
flicks a low full toss to deep midwicket
floated full and just around that wide line as Thisara looks to squeeze it behind square, but can't get to the ball
flays the low full toss to deep cover
ripper of a bouncer that kept Thisara honest as he ducked under it
full and wide outside off, in anticipation of the batsman trying to make room. Left alone
sways out of the way of that short ball angling away
floats this full on middle, defended with a straight bat

looks to swing this over midwicket, but the bat face turns in his hand as he makes contact. That means there's no power behind the stroke whatsoever. Lobs high. Long-off comes in, calls for it and then takes it. Bangladesh's second win ever in ODIs in Sri Lanka.
